Colors: Black, Black & Tan, Red, Grey, Silver
Long Description: A diminutive, hardy terrier-like toy dog known for its monkey-like face and entertaining personality. Loyal to family but wary of strangers.

Colors: Any solid color (Black, Cream, Red, etc.)
Long Description: An aristocratic sighthound characterized by its unique hip structure and luxurious coat. Requires significant outdoor space for running and early socialization.

Colors: Patchy, mottled pattern of Black, Yellow, White, Red
Long Description: The African Wild Dog is a highly endangered, specialized hunter with unique social habits, including pack voting and cooperative care of the sick. Not suitable for domestication.

Colors: Black or grizzle saddle on a tan body
Long Description: The 'King of Terriers,' Airedales are large, versatile dogs originally used for hunting otters. They are intelligent and protective, requiring firm but consistent training.

Colors: Any color, solid, parti, or patched (except white more than 80%)
Common Diseases: Cardiac disease, Cerebellar Ataxia, Hip Dysplasia
Long Description: A muscular, powerful dog known for its gentle nature with people, especially children, and its strong protective instincts. Requires early socialization with other dogs.

Colors: Tri-color (Black, Tan, and White)
Temperament Traits: Lively, agile, fearless, devoted to family
Long Description: The Appenzell Cattle Dog is a robust, athletic herding and driving dog. They are highly active and excel in canine sports, making them suitable only for very active families.

Colors: Blue & Tan, Red, Sandy
Long Description: A rugged, small terrier originally bred to hunt vermin and guard flocks. They are eager to please their family but retain a high prey drive.

Colors: Red, Black, Brindle, Tri-color (all with white)
Common Diseases: Fanconi Syndrome, Pyruvate Kinase Deficiency, Coloboma
Long Description: The 'barkless dog,' the Basenji is an ancient breed that cleans itself like a cat. They are challenging to train due to their independence and are escape artists.

Colors: Any hound color (Tri-color, Lemon and White, etc.)
Temperament Traits: Gentle, patient, devoted, stubborn, lazy indoors
Common Diseases: Ear Infections, Bloat, Glaucoma, Intervertebral Disc Disease
Long Description: Known for their long ears and mournful eyes, Bassets are excellent scent hounds. They are prone to stubbornness and require careful monitoring of weight due to their back structure.

Colors: Tri-color, Lemon and White, Red and White, Tan and White
Long Description: A popular, cheerful pack hound defined by its strong hunting instincts and love for food. Beagles require secure fencing due to their tendency to follow scents.

Colors: Blue, Liver, Sandy (with or without tan points)
Common Diseases: Copper Storage Disease, Renal Cortical Hypoplasia
Long Description: Known for their unique lamb-like appearance, Bedlington Terriers are surprisingly fierce hunters. They are gentle indoors but require significant grooming to maintain their coat.

Colors: Tri-color (Jet Black, Rust, and White)
Temperament Traits: Good-natured, calm, loyal, gentle with children
Long Description: A powerful, stunningly beautiful working breed originally used for carting and driving cattle. They are gentle giants who are sensitive and do not tolerate heat well.

Colors: Coal Black with rich Tan markings
Long Description: The only American Coonhound recognized by the AKC. They are driven scent hounds used for tracking raccoons. They are gentle family dogs but require a secure yard.

Colors: Ruby markings on pearly white coat
Common Diseases: Mitral Valve Disease (MVD), Syringomyelia (SM), Patellar Luxation
Long Description: A Cavalier King Charles Spaniel variety, highly popular for their gentle companionship. They thrive on human companionship and are prone to being overweight.

Colors: Black and Tan, Liver and Tan, Red
Long Description: The foremost scent detection dog, with a scenting power unrivaled by any other mammal. They are sweet and sensitive giants who require patience and experienced handling.

Colors: Dark Blue mottled/ticked on white, with Black and Tan patches
Long Description: A tireless, cold-nosed hunting dog known for its unique coloring. They are intelligent but single-minded when on a scent and require a high-energy outlet.

Colors: Black/White, Red/White, Merle, Sable
Exercise Needs: Extreme (needs a demanding job, not just exercise)
Common Diseases: Collie Eye Anomaly (CEA), Hip Dysplasia, Epilepsy
Long Description: Widely considered the most intelligent dog breed, the Border Collie requires constant mental and physical challenges. Without a 'job,' they become bored and potentially destructive.

Colors: Grizzle and Tan, Blue and Tan, Red, Wheaten
Common Diseases: Canine Epileptoid Cramping Syndrome (CECS), Patellar Luxation
Long Description: One of the oldest British terrier breeds, they were bred to run with the foxhounds. They are excellent companions and generally good with children, but retain a strong prey drive.

Colors: Any color combination
Temperament Traits: Quiet, dignified, sensitive, independent, calm indoors
Long Description: A large, elegant Russian sighthound historically used for wolf hunting. They are couch potatoes indoors but require intense bursts of speed daily in a safe, fenced area.

Colors: Brindle, Seal, or Black with white markings
Long Description: The 'American Gentleman' is a cheerful, devoted dog known for its tuxedo markings. As a brachycephalic breed, they require strict temperature control to prevent overheating.

Colors: Fawn, Black, Grey, Brindle, Salt and Pepper
Grooming Requirements: Very High (daily brushing to prevent matting)
Long Description: A strong, powerful dog historically used for cattle driving and guarding. They are devoted and protective family members who require early socialization and consistent training.

Colors: Fawn, Brindle (with or without white markings)
Temperament Traits: Playful, energetic, loyal, patient with children
Common Diseases: Cancer, Aortic Stenosis (heart), Bloat, Hip Dysplasia
Long Description: Known as the 'Peter Pan' of the dog world, Boxers retain their playful, puppy-like energy well into old age. They are devoted to their families but sensitive to heat.

Colors: Red, Black, Black and Tan
Exercise Needs: Low to Moderate (indoor play is often sufficient)
Long Description: The smooth-coated variety of the Brussels Griffon. They are intelligent, curious, and thrive on being the center of attention. They are prone to separation anxiety.

Colors: Black, Grey, Fawn (all uniform)
Common Diseases: Bloat, Night Blindness (Congenital Stationary), Hip Dysplasia
Grooming Requirements: Very High (daily/weekly brushing to prevent matting)
Long Description: A large, powerful French herding dog known for its protective nature and long, shaggy coat. They bond intensely with their families and require significant commitment to grooming and training.

Colors: Orange and White, Liver and White, Tri-color (mostly white)
Coat Type: Dense, flat or wavy, medium length
Temperament Traits: Energetic, eager to please, enthusiastic, gentle
Long Description: A tireless, dual-purpose gun dog (pointer and retriever). Brittanys are medium-sized, highly trainable, and require a very active family lifestyle.

Colors: Fawn, Red, Brindle (with black mask)
Temperament Traits: Brave, protective, devoted, calm, silent guardian
Common Diseases: Hip/Elbow Dysplasia, Cancer, Bloat, Eyelid Issues
Long Description: The 'Gamekeeper's Night Dog,' bred to deter poachers without mauling. They are massive, protective dogs that are surprisingly docile indoors but need careful management of their exercise to protect joints.

Colors: Cream, Wheaten, Red, Gray, Brindle
Coat Type: Double coat: harsh outer coat, soft undercoat
Common Diseases: Cairn Terrier Cramp, Ocular Melanosis, Liver Shunt
Long Description: A spirited, inquisitive small terrier known for its cheerful demeanor and deep-seated instinct to dig and hunt. Requires secure fencing due to prey drive.

Colors: Red, Sable, Brindle, Black (all with or without tan/blue points)
Common Diseases: Intervertebral Disc Disease (IVDD), Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA)
Long Description: The Cardigan Welsh Corgi is distinguished by its long, fox-like tail. They are excellent, devoted companions and intelligent herders who require consistent mental stimulation.

Colors: Brown, Sedge, Deadgrass (unique colors matching environment)
Temperament Traits: Powerful, courageous, sensitive, fiercely loyal, willful
Exercise Needs: Extreme (needs swimming and intense retrieval work)
Common Diseases: Hip Dysplasia, Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA), Gastric Torsion (Bloat)
Grooming Requirements: Low (minimal brushing; do not wash out oil)
Long Description: The ultimate American water retriever, known for its ability to withstand icy waters. They are powerful working dogs who bond deeply and require a very active, experienced owner.

Colors: Any color, solid or marked
Common Diseases: Patellar Luxation, Hypoglycemia, Molera (soft spot on skull)
Long Description: The world's smallest dog, known for its huge personality. They are fiercely loyal to one person and require protection from cold and rough play due to their fragile size.

Colors: Red, Black, Blue, Cinnamon, Cream
Long Description: An ancient, powerful breed distinguished by its lion's-mane ruff and unique blue-black tongue. Chows are highly independent, quiet, and reserved with strangers.

Colors: White with Lemon or Orange markings
Long Description: The largest of the spaniels, known for their heavy build and thoughtful expression. They are excellent hunting dogs and docile house companions, though they are prone to drooling and snoring.

Colors: ASCOB (Any Solid Color Other than Black), Black, Parti-color
Coat Type: Medium length, silky, flat or wavy
Temperament Traits: Happy, gentle, eager to please, trustworthy
Common Diseases: Ear Infections, Eye problems (PRA, Cataracts), Patellar Luxation
Grooming Requirements: High (daily brushing, professional clipping every 6-8 weeks)
Long Description: The American Cocker is known for its domed head and large, expressive eyes. They are popular family dogs but require diligent ear care due to their long, floppy ears.

Colors: Sable and White, Tri-color, Blue Merle, White
Long Description: Made famous by 'Lassie,' Collies are loyal family dogs known for their elegant appearance and profound gentleness with children. They are highly sensitive to their owner's emotions.

Colors: Black, Liver
Common Diseases: Hip Dysplasia, Glycogen Storage Disease (GSD IIIa), Retinal Dysplasia
Grooming Requirements: Low (minimal brushing; brushing destroys the curl)
Long Description: The oldest of the retriever breeds, recognized by its unique coat of tight curls. They are powerful, sensitive dogs that require gentle but consistent training.

Colors: Pepper (dark blue-black) or Mustard (reddish-brown)
Coat Type: Mix of hard and soft hair, prominent silky topknot
Long Description: A unique, long-bodied terrier known for its distinctive 'topknot' of soft, silky hair. They are gentle companions indoors but retain a strong hunting instinct outdoors.

Colors: Rust Red to Brown
Temperament Traits: Highly social, cooperative, fierce hunter, curious
Barking Level: Very Low (Uses a distinctive **whistle** or scream)
Common Diseases: Susceptible to domestic canine diseases (parvovirus, distemper)
Long Description: The Asiatic Wild Dog, known as the 'whistling hunter.' They live in complex packs and are strictly wild animals not suitable for domestication.

Colors: Ginger, Sand, Red, Black & Tan
Temperament Traits: Highly independent, cautious, territorial, elusive, curious
Long Description: The Australian Dingo is an ancient, primitive canid. They are protected wild animals and not suitable as domestic pets due to their high independence and complex needs.

Colors: Black, Red, Blue, Fawn (all with rust markings)
Temperament Traits: Fearless, intelligent, determined, loyal, high energy
Exercise Needs: High (Needs intense exercise and mental work)
Common Diseases: Dilated Cardiomyopathy (DCM), Wobbler Syndrome, Hip Dysplasia
Long Description: A sleek, powerful guard dog known for its endurance, speed, and devotion. Dobermans thrive on structure and training and are gentle family companions when properly socialized.

Colors: Any hound color (Tri-color, Bi-color)
Exercise Needs: Extreme (needs to run long distances daily)
Long Description: Bred purely for the pursuit of fox, this dog is happiest running in a pack. They are gentle but not ideal for family life due to their profound need for activity and companionship.

Colors: Blue Belton, Orange Belton, Lemon Belton, Tri-color
Grooming Requirements: High (daily brushing to prevent matting of feathering)
Long Description: An elegant, medium-sized gun dog known for its 'belton' (ticked) coat patterns. They are sweet and mellow family dogs but retain a strong prey drive and need significant outdoor activity.

Colors: Black/White, Liver/White, Tri-color, Blue or Liver Roan
Coat Type: Medium length, flat or wavy, waterproof
Temperament Traits: Eager to please, loyal, enthusiastic, active
Common Diseases: Hip Dysplasia, Ear Infections, Eye problems
Long Description: The English Springer Spaniel is a compact, energetic gundog known for 'springing' game into action. They are playful, affectionate family dogs that excel in dog sports.

Colors: Tri-color (Black, Tan, and White)
Long Description: The smallest of the four Swiss Mountain Dogs. They are highly motivated, intelligent herding dogs that require a lot of daily mental and physical challenges to prevent restlessness.

Colors: White, Black, Red, Grey, Sable (often mixed)
Long Description: The Canadian Eskimo Dog (Inuit Sled Dog) is a powerful, ancient breed that thrives in cold climates. They are gentle with their pack (family) but require an owner dedicated to high levels of activity.

Colors: Black, Liver
Temperament Traits: Optimistic, cheerful, eager to please, perpetual puppy
Common Diseases: Cancer (high incidence), Hip Dysplasia, Patellar Luxation
Long Description: Known as the 'Peter Pan' of the retriever world, they retain a youthful, playful attitude for years. They are exuberant and excellent family dogs, requiring firm but gentle training.

Colors: Brindle, Fawn, White, Cream
Common Diseases: Breathing difficulties (Brachycephalic), Spinal issues, Eye problems
Long Description: The Frenchie is a compact, devoted companion dog. As a brachycephalic breed, they are highly sensitive to heat and cannot be over-exercised.

Colors: Black & Tan, Sable, Black, Bi-Color
Temperament Traits: Loyal, courageous, confident, intelligent, aloof with strangers
Exercise Needs: Very High (Needs a "job" or intense activity)
Common Diseases: Hip and Elbow Dysplasia, Bloat (GDV), Degenerative Myelopathy
Long Description: A versatile, highly intelligent working breed that requires consistent training and early socialization. Known as the world's leading police, military, and service dog.

Colors: Liver, Liver & White, Roan
Temperament Traits: Energetic, versatile, eager to please, athletic
Long Description: A powerful, intelligent gun dog capable of hunting on land and water. GSPs are tireless athletes who require extensive daily exercise and a working partnership with their owner.

Colors: Black, Salt and Pepper
Long Description: The largest of the Schnauzer breeds, originally bred to drive cattle. They are powerful, assertive dogs that require confident, experienced ownership and early socialization.

Colors: Shades of Gold, Cream, Dark Gold
Coat Type: Dense, water-repellent outer coat, firm undercoat
Long Description: One of the most popular family dogs, known for their sweet temperament and strong retrieval instincts. They are excellent service and therapy dogs.

Colors: Black with rich Mahogany/Tan markings
Coat Type: Medium length, straight or slightly wavy, feathered
Common Diseases: Hip/Elbow Dysplasia, Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA), Bloat
Long Description: The largest and heaviest of the Setter breeds, known for its elegant black and tan coloring. They are devoted to family but require a dedicated exercise regimen.

Colors: Fawn, Brindle, Blue, Black, Harlequin, Mantle
Temperament Traits: Gentle giant, friendly, reserved with strangers, sensitive
Exercise Needs: Moderate (must be short and gentle while growing)
Long Description: Known as the 'Apollo of Dogs,' Great Danes are giant, friendly companions. They have extremely short lifespans and require specialized care to manage their growth and Bloat risk.

Colors: White (with possible badger, tan, or gray markings)
Long Description: A majestic livestock guardian dog, bred to think for itself. They are gentle with their family/flock but deeply suspicious of intruders. Requires experienced handling.

Colors: Tri-color (Black, Red/Rust, and White)
Long Description: The largest and oldest of the four Swiss Mountain Dogs. They are powerful carting dogs that are gentle and good-natured family companions, despite their size.

Colors: Solid Black
Exercise Needs: Very High (needs intense mental and physical work)
Long Description: The Groenendael is one of the four varieties of the Belgian Shepherd Dog. They are highly active, sensitive, and thrive on working closely with their owners in complex tasks.

Colors: Red, White, Red & White
Long Description: An elegant, ancient sighthound known for its rabbit-hunting prowess. Indoors, they are quiet and gentle, but require high fencing due to their jumping ability.

Colors: Mahogany or deep Red
Common Diseases: Hip Dysplasia, Canine Leukocyte Adhesion Deficiency (CLAD), PRA
Long Description: A beautiful, energetic bird dog known for its striking red coat. They are slow to mature and retain their puppy energy for several years, requiring constant activity.

Colors: Red, Red Wheaten, Wheaten
Long Description: The 'Daredevil' of the terrier group, known for its deep red coat and courage. They are sensitive to family praise but can be scrappy with strange dogs.

Colors: Solid Liver
Temperament Traits: Clownish, eager, alert, devoted, high energy
Long Description: The largest of the spaniels, recognized by its tight curls and 'rat tail.' They are powerful water dogs with a mischievous, clownish personality and are highly intelligent.

Colors: Grey, Brindle, Red, Black, White, Fawn
Temperament Traits: Gentle giant, loyal, calm, patient, reserved
Exercise Needs: Moderate (must be restricted when young; needs short sprints as an adult)
Long Description: The tallest of all dog breeds, the Irish Wolfhound is a gentle, dignified giant. Their lifespan is tragically short, and they require specialized care due to their giant size.

Colors: All colors and markings
Common Diseases: Leg Fractures (due to delicate bones), Patellar Luxation, PRA
Long Description: A tiny, elegant version of the Greyhound, prized as companions for millennia. They are fragile and highly sensitive to cold, requiring protective clothing in winter.

Colors: Black and White, Red and White
Common Diseases: Patellar Luxation, Eye problems, Brachycephalic Airway Syndrome
Grooming Requirements: High (daily brushing of coat and feathering)
Long Description: A royal companion dog from Japan, known for its expressive face and cat-like habit of pawing at its face. They are sensitive to heat and require specialized cooling.

Colors: Silver and Black, Cream and Black (distinct 'spectacles' marking)
Long Description: The Keeshond is a natural watchdog and companion known for its thick coat and distinctive facial markings resembling spectacles. They thrive on family interaction.

Colors: Black, Red, Chocolate, Blue, Fawn (often with tan)
Long Description: An incredibly smart, high-drive herding dog developed in Australia. Kelpies are not suitable as pets unless they have a full-time, demanding job to perform.

Colors: Any shade of blue-grey (born black, color fades)
Exercise Needs: Moderate to High (needs secure play area)
Long Description: The national dog of Ireland, known for its soft blue coat. They are versatile working dogs, equally skilled at hunting vermin and serving as protective companions.

Colors: White
Temperament Traits: Brave, reserved, independent, serious livestock guardian
Grooming Requirements: Extreme (cords must be manually separated weekly; no brushing)
Long Description: A giant, ancient livestock guardian distinguished by its corded coat, which protects it from predators and weather. Requires experienced handling due to independent nature.

Colors: White (ivory color acceptable)
Temperament Traits: Loyal, intensely protective, independent, gentle with family
Long Description: A large, beautiful livestock guardian. Kuvaszok bond intensely with their human family and livestock, and their protective instinct is powerful, demanding early socialization.

Colors: Black, Yellow, Chocolate
Temperament Traits: Friendly, outgoing, eager to please, high energy
Common Diseases: Hip/Elbow Dysplasia, Exercise Induced Collapse (EIC), Retinal Dysplasia, Obesity
Long Description: The quintessential family and service dog, known for its gentle mouth and water love. Labs are prone to obesity and require careful portion control.

Colors: Blue, Black, Liver, Red, Wheaten, Grizzle
Coat Type: Wiry, dense, hard outer coat, soft undercoat
Long Description: A tough, game terrier originally bred to hunt fox in the Lake District mountains. They are affectionate companions but retain strong predatory instincts.

Colors: Lion Yellow, Red, Reddish Brown (with black mask)
Long Description: A giant, gentle breed often described as a mix of Newfoundland, Saint Bernard, and Pyrenees. They are excellent family dogs known for their patience and love of water.

Colors: Gold, Cream, Honey, Dark Grizzle, Black
Common Diseases: Cherry Eye, Renal Dysplasia, Patellar Luxation
Grooming Requirements: Extreme (daily brushing required for long coat)
Long Description: Used as sentinels in Tibetan monasteries, they are assertive and protective watchdogs. They require extensive grooming to maintain their luxurious coats.

Colors: Various shades of Gray and White, Black and White, Red and White
Coat Type: Thick, coarse double coat, stands off the body
Temperament Traits: Loyal, playful, dignified, highly independent, stubborn
Exercise Needs: Extreme (needs to pull/run in cool weather)
Long Description: The Alaskan Malamute is a powerful, heavy freighting dog. They are highly social with humans but have strong pack instincts and require firm, consistent leadership.

Colors: Rich Fawn to Mahogany (with black mask)
Temperament Traits: Intelligent, highly energetic, devoted, protective, sensitive
Long Description: The Belgian Malinois is one of the world's most capable working dogs (military/police). They are extremely intense and are not suitable for novice owners or inactive lifestyles.

Colors: White
Common Diseases: Patellar Luxation, White Shaker Syndrome, Hypoglycemia
Long Description: An ancient breed prized for its beauty and gentle nature. The Maltese is a delicate dog that requires intensive grooming and dental care.

Colors: Black, Slate, Red, Bronze, Liver
Coat Type: Hairless or very short, smooth (Coated variety exists)
Temperament Traits: Calm, tranquil, loyal, reserved with strangers, alert
Common Diseases: Dental issues (due to hairless gene), Skin problems (sunburn, acne)
Long Description: An ancient, primitive breed known for its strong bond with its family and sensitive nature. They were historically used as warming beds.

Colors: Red, Black and Rust, Chocolate and Rust
Temperament Traits: Fearless, proud, lively, assertive, high energy
Long Description: The 'King of the Toys,' a sturdy, bold dog known for its unique high-stepping gait. They are assertive and require confident, consistent handling.

Colors: Black, White, Apricot, Cream, Silver, Brown
Temperament Traits: Very intelligent, playful, eager to please, alert
Common Diseases: Patellar Luxation, Epilepsy, Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA)
Grooming Requirements: High (Daily brushing, professional groom every 4-6 weeks)
Long Description: The perfect middle-sized Poodle, retaining the intelligence and athletic ability of the Standard but scaled down for apartment living. They are excellent family dogs known for their trainability.

Colors: Salt and Pepper, Black and Silver, Black
Coat Type: Wiry, hard outer coat, soft undercoat
Common Diseases: Pancreatitis, Urinary Stones, PRA, Patellar Luxation
Long Description: A robust, outgoing terrier known for its distinctive beard and eyebrows. They are excellent companions and adaptable family dogs, but prone to weight gain.

Colors: Black, Brown, Gray, Landseer (Black & White)
Common Diseases: Subvalvular Aortic Stenosis (SAS), Cystinuria, Bloat, Hip Dysplasia
Long Description: The 'gentle giant' of the dog world, originally bred to rescue fishermen. They are renowned for their patient nature, love of water, and devotion to children.

Colors: Red, Wheaten, Black and Tan, Grizzle
Long Description: The smallest of the working terriers, known for its drop ears. They are affectionate companions and excellent rodent hunters.

Colors: Gray (dark saddle, silver tips)
Common Diseases: Hip/Elbow Dysplasia, Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA), Renal Dysplasia
Long Description: An ancient Nordic hunting dog used for tracking and holding elk/moose. They are highly protective of their family but require substantial exercise and cool weather.

Colors: Red, Wheaten, Black and Tan, Grizzle
Common Diseases: Norwich Terrier Upper Airway Syndrome (NTUAS), Patellar Luxation
Long Description: A small, sturdy terrier known for its prick ears. They are energetic and affectionate, making them great companions but require supervision around small prey animals.

Colors: Grey, Grizzle, Blue (with white markings)
Long Description: Known for their signature shaggy coat covering their eyes, they are gentle, family-oriented dogs. They require an enormous commitment to grooming.

Colors: Black, Tan, Wheaten, Grizzle
Temperament Traits: Boisterous, amiable, independent, enthusiastic, sensitive nose
Long Description: A rare, large rough-coated hound known for its incredible ability to scent in water. They are playful but have a loud voice and require a lot of space.

Colors: White with patches of any color
Coat Type: Long, silky, single coat, feathered ears
Common Diseases: Patellar Luxation, Dental issues, Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA)
Long Description: Known for its large, butterfly-like ears. The Papillon is an athletic, intelligent toy breed that excels in agility and obedience.

Colors: All colors and markings (often Red, Sable, Black)
Long Description: An ancient Chinese companion dog, bred for royalty. They are flat-faced (brachycephalic) and require protection from heat and rough handling.

Colors: Red, Sable, Fawn, Black and Tan (with or without white)
Temperament Traits: Intelligent, devoted, bold, playful, eager to please
Common Diseases: Intervertebral Disc Disease (IVDD), Hip Dysplasia, Eye problems
Long Description: The Pembroke Welsh Corgi is a low-set, sturdy herding dog known for its 'bobtail' appearance. They are highly intelligent, energetic, and prone to barking.

Colors: All colors (Orange, Black, Cream, Sable most common)
Common Diseases: Tracheal Collapse, Patellar Luxation, Hypoglycemia, Alopecia X
Long Description: A tiny dog with a huge, flamboyant personality, known for its fox-like face and thick ruff. Poms are often unaware of their small size and are highly protective.

Colors: Fawn, Black (with black mask)
Common Diseases: Breathing difficulties (Brachycephalic), Eye injuries, Pug Dog Encephalitis (PDE)
Long Description: Known for their wrinkled face, curly tail, and flat muzzle. Pugs are charming, ancient companion dogs highly prone to overheating and obesity.

Colors: Solid Red
Temperament Traits: Eager to please, persistent, adaptable, protective
Long Description: A beautiful, versatile coonhound known for its striking red coat. They are dedicated hunting partners who are gentle and affectionate house companions.

Colors: Light Wheaten to Red Wheaten
Common Diseases: Dermoid Sinus (congenital spine defect), Hip/Elbow Dysplasia, Bloat
Long Description: Known for the signature ridge of hair running backward down its spine. Bred to hunt lions, they are powerful, dignified, and require early socialization and strong leadership.

Colors: Black with clearly defined rust markings
Common Diseases: Hip/Elbow Dysplasia, Aortic Stenosis, Bloat, Osteosarcoma
Long Description: A strong, formidable working breed historically used for driving cattle and pulling carts. They are gentle and playful with family but reserved and protective of strangers, requiring experienced handling.

Colors: Red and White, Brown and White
Temperament Traits: Gentle giant, patient, watchful, sociable, placid
Exercise Needs: Moderate (must avoid heat and strenuous activity)
Common Diseases: Bloat, Hip/Elbow Dysplasia, Osteosarcoma, Eyelid Issues
Long Description: Known for their rescue work in the Swiss Alps. They are giant, loving dogs that are sensitive to heat and require specialized joint and growth management.

Colors: White, Cream, Fawn, Golden, Black/Tan, Tri-color
Coat Type: Smooth (short) or Feathered (long ears and tail)
Long Description: One of the oldest dog breeds, historically used by Egyptian royalty. They are reserved and gentle indoors but are driven sighthounds requiring extreme security outdoors.

Colors: White, Cream, Biscuit
Temperament Traits: Friendly, adaptable, gentle, playful, mischievous ('Sammy Smile')
Long Description: A beautiful, spitz-type sled dog known for its perpetually smiling expression. They are highly social and require consistent exercise and cool weather.

Colors: Solid Black
Coat Type: Thick, harsh, stand-off ruff and culottes
Temperament Traits: Curious, fearless, highly active, mischievous, stubborn
Long Description: A small, fox-like Belgian barge dog known for its dense black coat and intense curiosity. They are excellent, persistent watchdogs.

Colors: Black, Brindle, Wheaten
Common Diseases: Scotty Cramp, Craniomandibular Osteopathy (CMO), Cushing's Disease
Long Description: The Scottish Terrier is a distinctive, low-set terrier known for its confidence and beard. They are highly independent and require patient, firm training.

Colors: Blue-gray, Gray, Brindle, Yellow, Red
Temperament Traits: Dignified, gentle, polite, affectionate, quiet indoors
Long Description: A giant sighthound bred to hunt red deer. They are gentle, reserved dogs that require large, secure areas for exercise and are highly sensitive to handling.

Colors: White (may have lemon, badger, or tan markings on head)
Long Description: A sturdy, charming terrier known for its prominent foreface furnishings. They are devoted companions but retain a strong prey drive and enjoy digging.

Colors: Sable, Tri-color, Blue Merle, Bi-Black
Coat Type: Long, harsh outer coat, thick undercoat
Temperament Traits: Intelligent, sensitive, devoted, gentle, reserved with strangers
Common Diseases: Collie Eye Anomaly (CEA), Hypothyroidism, Hip Dysplasia
Long Description: A miniature working Collie, known as the 'Sheltie.' They are extremely intelligent, sensitive, and thrive on pleasing their owners, but are prone to excessive barking.

Colors: All colors, most often Gold, White, Black
Long Description: Bred to resemble a lion, the Shih Tzu is a gentle companion dog. They are brachycephalic and require daily grooming to prevent severe matting.

Colors: Black/White, Gray/White, Red/White, Sable/White
Temperament Traits: Mischievous, independent, friendly, high energy, pack-oriented
Common Diseases: Hip Dysplasia, Zinc Deficiency, Eye problems (Cataracts, PRA)
Long Description: A swift, light-footed sled dog. Huskies are notoriously independent escape artists with a profound need for exercise and human/canine companionship.

Colors: Blue and Tan
Long Description: A true terrier in a toy package, known for its beautiful blue and tan coat. They are energetic and require daily combing to prevent matting.

Colors: Any shade of Wheaten
Common Diseases: Protein-Losing Enteropathy (PLE), Protein-Losing Nephropathy (PLN), Renal Dysplasia
Long Description: Known for the 'Wheaten Greetin'' (enthusiastic jumping), they are happy, energetic family dogs. They require significant brushing to maintain their soft coat.

Colors: Red, Fawn, White, Black, Blue, Brindle (often with white)
Temperament Traits: Affectionate, courageous, reliable, good with children
Common Diseases: L-2-Hydroxyglutaric Aciduria (L2HGA), Hereditary Cataracts, Hip Dysplasia
Long Description: Known as the 'Nanny Dog' in Britain for their reliability with children. They are muscular, affectionate dogs who require socialization with other dogs.

Colors: Black, White, Apricot, Cream, Silver, Brown
Temperament Traits: Extremely intelligent, loyal, athletic, dignified, friendly
Common Diseases: Hip Dysplasia, Bloat (GDV), Addison's Disease, SA
Grooming Requirements: High (Daily brushing, professional groom every 4-6 weeks)
Long Description: The "original" Poodle, Standard Poodles are elegant, powerful athletes. They are highly sensitive and require significant mental and physical stimulation to prevent boredom.

Colors: Salt and Pepper, Black
Coat Type: Wiry, hard outer coat, soft undercoat
Temperament Traits: Alert, reliable, devoted, high energy, robust
Long Description: The original Schnauzer, a sturdy, medium-sized working dog. They are highly intelligent and protective, requiring consistent exercise and mental challenges.

Colors: Rich Golden Liver (unique to the breed)
Coat Type: Abundant, flat or slightly wavy, feathered
Long Description: A unique spaniel known for its low, long body, slow gait, and deep, resonant bark. They are generally placid companions but require persistence in training.

Colors: Black, Brown, Blue, Gold (often with tan)
Coat Type: Thick, long double coat, heavy ruff
Common Diseases: Hip/Elbow Dysplasia, Hypothyroidism, Canine Inherited Demyelinative Neuropathy (CIDN)
Long Description: A giant, ancient livestock guardian. TMs are highly reserved with strangers and are naturally nocturnal watchdogs, requiring experienced ownership.

Colors: Any color except chocolate/liver
Temperament Traits: Loyal, charming, sensitive, playful, reserved with strangers
Long Description: Known as the 'Holy Dogs of Tibet,' they were companion dogs and watchdogs. They are intelligent and agile but require daily grooming.

Colors: Black, White, Apricot, Cream, Silver, Brown
Common Diseases: Patellar Luxation, Legg-Calvé-Perthes, Dental Disease, PRA
Grooming Requirements: High (Daily brushing, professional groom every 4-6 weeks)
Long Description: The smallest of the Poodle family, the Toy Poodle is a bright and charming companion. They are highly trainable and thrive on human interaction.

Colors: Black and Tan
Long Description: The English Toy Terrier (Black and Tan) is a sleek, elegant toy dog with a true terrier spirit. They are sensitive to cold and require warm clothing.

Colors: Golden Rust
Temperament Traits: Affectionate, sensitive, gentle, energetic, desires closeness
Long Description: Nicknamed the 'Velcro dog' due to its extreme attachment to its owner. Vizslas are high-energy, sensitive gun dogs requiring active companionship.

Colors: Tri-color (Black, White, and Tan)
Long Description: The Treeing Walker Coonhound is a fast, tireless hunter known for its clear, ringing bark. They are energetic and require secure fencing.

Colors: Mouse-Gray, Silver-Gray
Temperament Traits: Fearless, friendly, intelligent, devoted, high energy
Exercise Needs: Extreme (needs running, work, and sustained activity)
Long Description: Known as the 'Gray Ghost,' Weimaraners are highly intelligent, high-energy gun dogs that require constant companionship. They are notoriously prone to separation anxiety.

Colors: Rich Red and White
Temperament Traits: Loyal, busy, tenacious, affectionate, highly active
Long Description: A compact, active gundog known for its beautiful red and white coat. They are friendly family dogs that require consistent daily exercise and mental challenges.

Colors: White
Coat Type: Double coat: hard outer coat, soft undercoat
Common Diseases: Atopic Dermatitis (skin allergies), Globoid Cell Leukodystrophy (Krabbe Disease), CMO
Long Description: A popular, cheerful terrier known for its white coat and confidence. They are strong-willed and require firm, consistent training and grooming.

Colors: Any color or combination
Common Diseases: Bloat, Anesthesia sensitivity, Von Willebrand's Disease (VWD)
Long Description: Often called the 'poor man's racehorse.' Whippets are gentle, polite house dogs that require intense sprinting exercise daily in a secure area.

Colors: White with Black and/or Tan markings
Long Description: A classic, active terrier known for its spirited demeanor. They are highly intelligent but require strong leadership to manage their assertive nature.

Colors: Blue and Tan
Exercise Needs: Low to Moderate (indoor play is sufficient)
Common Diseases: Tracheal Collapse, Patellar Luxation, Hypoglycemia, Dental disease
Long Description: A tiny, confident terrier known for its long, silky coat. Despite their size, they are fearless and require diligent grooming and dental care.
